@guozhangwang changes per comments

Added the check back to the top of the method if either map contains the state store name.  

Also, I thought about it some more and IMHO we shouldn't allow both topics and regex patterns to connect to state store.  When the consumer fetches the topics matching the pattern we need to add those topics to the `stateStoreNameToSourceTopics` map at that point.  According to the comment on line 883 we should not update map once it's set.  

Thanks!

@apurvam I think this might be confusion over when the logs are *generated* vs *collected*. If I'm reading the log4j configs properly, I think the issue might be that in most other cases we set the log level, but it's applied to a root logger that affects a log file that is always collected, whereas in this case I think you might have some settings adjusted for logs that are only ending up in log files that are not being collected by default (as per the `collect_default` settings).

> when they are working with project specific eclipse settings created before applying the gradle eclipse fix.

Thanks for the explanation.
Sorry for the delay  . Will check this out in the morning.
Merged to trunk.
Will also try to cherry-pick to 0.10.2 when 0.10.2.1 is released.
